name: Organ Trail: Director's Cut
developer: The Men Who Wear Many Hats
publisher: The Men Who Wear Many Hats
description: Organ Trail is a retro zombie survival game. Travel westward in a station wagon with 4 of your friends, scavenging for supplies and fending off the undead. Members of your party might die of dysentery or you might have to put them down yourself when they get bit.
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP SP2 Processor:1 GHz Memory:512 MB RAM DirectX®:9.0c Hard Drive:250 MB HD space
recommended_requirements: OS:Windows 7 Processor:1 GHz Memory:1 GB RAM DirectX®:9.0c Hard Drive:250 MB HD space

reviews.review_text: Remember Oregon Trail from gradeschool? This takes all the fun parts of that game and removes all of the educational value. Recommended!

Hello survivors. Look at your man. Now back at me. Now back at your man. Now back at me. Sadly, he isn't me, but if he stopped dicking around with useful scrap, he could be like me. Look down. Now back up. Where are you? You're in a station wagon with the man your man can be like. What's in your hand? Back at me. You have dysentry.

Instead of going to Oregon to stake a claim on America's future, you decide the fate of a group of survivors looking for a safe place to live in a post-apocalyptic world overridden by zombies. You travel from Washington DC, that's about to be nuked, all the way to a safe haven in, you guessed it, Oregon. The game is faithful in every way it can be to the Oregon Trail, except where it could be made more thematically appropriate to a zombie apocalypse, with multiple additions to improve the simulation and theming. Seriously, name a feature from Oregon Trail and it's there. Dysentary? Check. Bad water? Check. Tombstones? Check. You get the picture.  Oregon Trail's 'hunting' minigame, being the best part of the original, has become a bit more central to the experience with Scavenging and Jobs using it, with a few others including Defense, Surrounded and Bandit Raid events using the same shooting mechanics.  When Scavenging, you no longer shoot a 2000 pound buffalo to carry back 100 pounds of meat. Instead you rummage around a wilderness, collecting any supplies that pop up (including food, cash and scrap that you can use to repair your car), while avoiding and shooting zombies that swarm in on you. Learning to control the flow of these zombies to reduce the amount of ammo I have to spend was a fun mechanic to master (no doubt aided by my recent experience with Gauntlet), and I must say, is probably the best way to ensure your victory at the game.   In a funny way, Organ Trail is one of the most complete zombie apocalypse simulations I've played, and if you like the genre, you really should play it just because it's a fun game. If that's not enough to attract you, maybe the novelty of recreating the Oregon Trail experience on a modern platform with a modern genre is enough. I would happily recommend Organ Trail even at the premium price of five bucks.
6/10  Named one of my party members 'My p*nis'. Once he got infected, he turned and bit one of my other party members: 'My P*nis turned and bit My A$$'. As it was read.

I haven't played for too long but i can already tell it's a very funny modern day rendition of the 'original'. Your team will randomly die-off in the nostalgic manor of Oregon trail's disease contracting, leg breaking, attacked by zombie way. It's especially fun to play with people around and watch them cope with their in game characters dire conditions. In the game's defense, it appears there are ways to escape the madness and survive.
I have probably used most of my hours just restarting the game over and over watching and listening to the intro! Great game!
It's amazing I made a squad of people i know then watched them slowly die
Naming your survival team after your co-workers extends the fun. Why does Andrew keep getting dysentery? Why did Frank sit on a muffler and break it?

I love this game way more than I could put into words. Simple design, easy access, addicting. I would call it a 'retro survival sim': a zombie apocalypse ended the world as we know it. You and your friends try to cross what once was the USA from the East Coast to the West, chasing a rumor known as 'Safe Haven', a stronghold where the zombie outbreak seems to have been controlled. Your job is to admin everything until you reach Safe Haven, that is gas, money, routes, including scavenging for food, at what hours you should best do so, keeping an eye out for your ammo, deciding if you should keep going to the West Coast with your bitten friend or if he is a potential menace to the whole group and should be rather put down, if you should risk breaking your car driving for another mile in the hopes of finding a better trading spot, etc., etc.   These tasks may appear mundane at first, but once you soak in the rather dark atmosphere and realize how close you have become to those pixels with the name of random friends, the game becomes a tragic story of a group just trying to survive and their everyday trying to do so. And you are the leader.   It's so much fun to experience and imagine the situation you go through. One moment you'll think you made a great deal buying that tire for so cheap, the next you'll curse yourself for not having rather invested in scraps. And while on the road, you'll sometimes encounter little 'choose-your-own-adventure'-like events with fellow survivors, some friendly, others not so much, spicing up the experience.  Organ Trail is impressively immersive, given it's Atari graphics and lack of a deeper canon story. It's one of those video game experiences in which the game only makes the rules, while you make the story in your head, and I think this is the strongest point here.  But as good as it is, it has some very nasty bugs that can bring you serious frustration. For example, I just was at the end of the game, a comrade died and the game refused to advance until I fed all of them to the zombies. As if this wasn't enough, the game got stuck after defeating the final boss. After having spend my time carefully administrating my crew from coast to coast through hordes of zombies, this wasn't a rewarding pay off. I just wish such issues were patched already, since they happen relatively often with me, let's say, every 3rd or 4th playthrough.  Be it as it is, though, I can only recommend Organ Trail as a fantastic game for those who like just make up and imagine their own zombie stories while playing along.

Wow, just freakin wow. Love this game. Reminds me alot of the Oregon Trail I played as a kid except without the boring talk. Makes me chuckle every now and again especially if you name any of your party members Chuck Norris, with that name let the awesomeness begin.

good piece of retro survival! The gameplay is simple but fun, and the original's Oregon Trail painful aspects (keyboard aiming for an example) have been scraped out.   The game has many secrets and unique finds, aiming for a good replayability factor, but these events are so rare (i only came across 2 in 8 full gameplays, when the game says there are over 15) that you won't experience everything this game has to offer. The game is also a bit too short.   There are many, many events and possibilities, but the trailer's makes one believe that this will be also a psychological battle against yourself, with many moral dilemmas and such, when the largest one you will find is pressing a button to kill one of your crew.  6.5/10 ,only purchasable because its cheap , but not for everyone.
A pixel journey trought zombie-apocalyptic USA. Good to complete few times, many quests, some nice achievements and secrets included. I really enjoyed it.

Guys do yourselves a favour and spend that £4 as this game is amazing. It's involving, and even though the graphics arent anywhere near as good as graphics are today, guess what?? Thats because it came out decades ago. For me it still holds up today
This game is awesome. Super addicting, and always fun! Great spin on the original Oregon Trail. Would definitley reccomend to anyone.
Heal the party member, after 3 minutes he lost in the woods Repair the car, after 5 minutes tire burst Sacrifice Chuck Norris for saving the world  10 crawling zombies /10

Organ Trail resembles a certain other game, which I doubt I even need to name. Instead of a wagon, you have a station wagon, and instead of homesteading the west, you are trying to escape the zombie apocalypse... by going west! It might have simple graphics, yet it's fun and challenging. Sadly it does have some boring parts, where you just watch your car move, and terrible things like breaking a battery or someone getting bitten will happen. This makes it very similar to the game with a similar name, where someone will just randomly die of malaria, but the zombie apocalypse setting makes it way better. The resource management is also still there, while instead of hunting for animals, you will be hunting bandits or going for an item while zombies hunt you. Organ Trail is one of those simple games that ends up being pretty awesome. Pimp your ride, ford hordes, survive zombie deer herds, then get your brains gnoshed on by a zombie bear and have to start all over from the beginning... again.

I just purchased this game...I'm actually not even playing it, because I'm going to return it...yep what a jerk. I'm giving it a positive review though unlike many people who 'try' a game with Steam's new return policy and only have to have played it for less than five minutes to write a review...THIS POLICY IS WRONG. If you want to review a game you should have to at least give it a fair shake- play it for a full two hours. I could understand that, unfortunately with STEAM's return policy you aren't even required to play the game fore more than 5 minutes to write a review....then you can return it?! Does that make any sense to anyone?
The perfect game for anyone who thinks their life is too easy and wants to voluntarily stress themselves out.

A great indie title that alot more people should own, Despite the basic 8-bit Graphics, It still puts you into a first person perspective of a proper zombie apocolypse with each decision you make affecting the outcome of your whole game. Combined with the fact that you have the option to name your party members, it can get personal (or funny) when it comes to the point of where you need to say goodbye to your close friends, either as a late farewell, or a sacrafise. This game has so much to do and can keep you entertained for hours, And the soundtrack, My god the soundtrack is just brilliant. 8 Bit Music at it's absolute best. The shooting controls are a pain in the ♥♥♥♥, But that just adds to the challenge of the game and once you get use to it, It's not that bad. Overall, very very great game, Minor Flaws but a hell of a lot more upsides, I'm giving this an 8/10

Like Oregon Trail, but with zombies. Growing up in the US, many of us had elementary schools which bought Oregon Trail because it was educational. It was a lot of fun, but I'm not sure if I actually learned anything other than a lot more people died from diseases we no longer have to worry about such as cholera, typhoid fever, measles and dysentary.  I haven't really played much, but I have watched Game Grumps play this a bit. If I had to describe the genre it would be towards simulation where you have to manage resources. Combine that with the quirky humor (and pixel art) you expect from indie games.   My only complaint is that the gun controls are kind of strange. I'm not sure if this is intentional or not, but I play with an unusual control setup so it's kind of difficult for me. So far, shooting the gun doesn't seem necessary to complete the game, but maybe on the harder difficulties will require this more.
It's kind of like dust II but different

Fun little resource-management game with a good dose of humour, a modicum of challenge, and plenty of dice rolls that aren't in the party's favour.  Plays better with keyboard & mouse than touchscreen.  - Skinny from the Fat B*stard  (curator link)

The Organ Trail is based off the other computer game most kids in the 90's played in school. Cause it was the only game we could actully play in school that the teacher wouldn't yell at us for playing.  The graphics are minimal, and I honestly applaud that, to many developers think that they need top notch 3D graphics to make a game fun, when you just need to have fun gameplay. This game delivers fun gameplay in spades.  You start off by picking the names of your companions, so you can sentance people you disilke to die or bring friends with you in spirit, after that its pretty much a zombie road trip, bad things will happen, you can try and prepare for it the best you can, but you are on a road trip cross country to reach a safe haven.  The game has plenty of easter eggs, homages, and is just down right awesome, if you love zombie games, and adore indie games you really need to pick this one up for yourself.
Does exactly what it's trying to do.
If you don't own this, and you like either - Oregon Trail, or zombies, what the heck are you waiting for? Get it.
Loved it to death. Not a hell of a lot of re-play value, but a challenging run, the hokey old timey graphics work very well in its favor. Definetely one to pick up if only for the hilarity. 8/10
I love this game so much, everything about it is awesome! like the little easter eggs and the 8-bit soundtrack just makes it.

This is the best zombie survival game I've ever played. For as simple looking as it is, it's actually very thorough with a ton of content. It's hard to understand the first time you play it. But once you get used to how it all works, it can be very addicting. I like the click-pull-shoot idea (which is almost impossible without a mouse) for the 2d game, it might be difficult to do at first but it’s a whole different shooting system. I would recommend this game mostly for passing the time though, it is very fun, but not something you (or at least I) would actually put time aside to play. But all in all, this game is definitely worth 4.99. The best part is writing and finding you own gravestone when you die, or when you visit a grave.  Get it. If you’ve ever played low graphic games and liked them, you’ll like this.
A fun take on a classic. While i'm not a fan of zombie games, this gave me more than a few good laughs and distracted me from the real monsters out there.

The Organ Trail.... Its just like the Oregon Trail but this time with ZAMBIEZ. You have to make it to the end to defeat the final boss. The game isn't over all exciting but it isn't boring. It is kind of hard to do missions when you get to different areas but the challenge is what makes it fun. Its also at a great price. I wasn't dissapointed with it and wasn't impressed. The best thing it has is choosing wether to shoot your teammate if they're hurt or to use more supplies up to save them. Of course the final boss will be much easier with more people.   Organ Trail gets a 6/10
Great horror spin off of a classic. Would love to see some DLC available. Perhaps a different car, new destination, etc.

This game is just plain awesome! I don't want to put it down but I have to go to bed because I have work in the morning. Learning how to shoot accurately takes a little time and can be frusterating, but once you get the hang of it, you'll be having a blast.
Highly Recommended Game

Fun simple game if interested in a parody of oregon trail. Has some bugs, some broken achievements (most work). If you have no expectations, this game is fun like a zombified oregon trail.  Have not played the free flash version of the game, so can't compare.  You can shoot your friends or let them die of dysentery or cholera!

Ever wanted to play a game that allows you to fight zombies and die of dysteria? Loook NO FURTHER!!!!! NOW U CAN!!!!!  this game is pretty fun and similar to the old oregon trail games, the mini games are different with looking for food and fighting boss zombies, and I usually have a difficult time doing some of these. I personally wish the graphics were upped some but im sure alot of people will still enjoy the old look to what the original game was. Overall it was a pretty fun game and i rate it 7 hungry flesh eating green zombies out of 10 dysteria dieing survivors.
>my party member, Gotchab*tch, was dicking around with 50 dollars and ruined it >LOOK AT THE FLOWERS, GOTCHAB*TCH, JUST LOOK AT THE FLOWERS *bang*
The Only Credits Scene I was Actually Entertained By.
this = best game

I always wanted to play oregon trail again after playing a few minutes back in grade school. now, with this game, I have something vastly superior.  for what basically amounts to a pixel art and text based roguelike set in yet another zombie apocalyse, the atmosphere is surprisingly strong. you really get invested in the safety of those names next to the health bars on the screen.
Named my party after famous dictators, Hitler accidentally shot Stalin. 10/10 would play again.

*made gaben part of my group* *gets 4 landmarks in and runs out of food for me and gaben* *has to put him down* *points gun at his head as he wispers 'your the reason half Life 3 will never be released'* *shoots and cries for 3 days straight*   10/10 would kill a franchise again
Hours of fun! If you loved the classic Oregon Trail and you love Zombie Survival...this is for you! Quadruple thumbs up!

This Game is worth the purchase in my opinion, its a nice throwback to the 80's and its a nice pardoy this adds to the current retro movement thats been going on ever since blood dragon came out. besides that it adds its random events and it has a moral choice system throw in it which is well done along with the boss fights, theres alot of chuckles in this game and this game has one fine ♥♥♥ OST i've heard in a 8-Bit retro throwback game.
Awesome indie game, very reminiscent of the old Atari. Would seriously recommend.
love the game sooooooo much   many fond memories have come from it the soundtrack is awesome and so are the graphics makes me so nostalgic  kinda makes me tear up love it
Awesome indie game, very reminiscent of the old Atari. Would seriously recommend.
If I only had this one in elementary computer lab.
A great remake of the original game i played secretly in typing class. All the charm and fun of Oregon Trail, but with massive amounts of zombies!
Sat on money and broke it. 10/10
WHY HAVE YOU NOT BOUGHT THIS YET

As a child I played the Oregon Trail on those, now ancient, Apple II computers while in the computer lab of my elementary school. back then the thing to do was die of measles, snakebite, dysentery, typhoid, cholera, or exhaustion while moving along the historic Oregon Trail. I remember we had some good times trying to make that trip. My favorite thing to do in this game was to go hunting. It was so easy to point and click at the animal you wished to kill.  In Organ Trail: Director's Cut hunting is not nearly as easy. You have to hold down the mouse button and pull back in the equal but opposite direction to the zombie you want to kill. Over complicated for no reason. This is my only complaint about this game though.  I enjoy that this game brings back all of the old memories of my childhood while simultaneously including a modern spin on a post apocalyptic zombie outbreak. Each difficultly level is challenging but not so challenging that it is super frustrating. This is a great game that everyone can play comfortably without quitting in a thunderous rage.  I strongly recommend this game.

It's like L4D and Oregon Trail had a baby. People complain about the slingshot-style shooting mechanics, but I don't see what all the fuss is about. There are these mysterious achievements that nobody seems to know quite how to get them--it reminds me of the old days when rumors were the primary source of information.
Really fun, a much bigger, better experience than the free flash game. I was just expecting it to be a few variations on the original, but it's different enough they should have called it a sequel.
You have died of dysentery, zombies, starvation, or a damned flat tire.  Oregon trail, with zombies. 'nuff said.
Got IT, on my iPhone - perfect game for mobile devices = Cool, Scary, Hard Thinking, Survival....feel sorry for the thing you do / or not!...Must Have!!!:)

A hilarious remake of the classic educational video game Oregon Trail, Organ Trail places you as leader of a band of survivors fleeing the zomie apocalypse. Trek across the country in search of safety in your trusty station wagon and try to keep your party members, and yourself, alive.   Organ trail is packed with jokes about the original organ trail and plenty of references to zombies in other media. It's as fun as it is funny.
This game is AMAZING, I'll leave it at that. This'll be the most fun $5 (or under) can get you online.
This is actually a pretty good game. New take on the zombie genre.
Good Game! a blast from the past revamped with an undead twist!
Strangely addictive

I'm going to start out by saying that yes, this is at its core Oregon Trail. However, the devs put their own brand of humor into the game and add some fun, if repetitive, minigames. Plus it's fun to see your party of five (I name mine with stupid names for lols) go through some rough stuff. Replay value is kinda low, but damn is it fun when you decide to pick it up again.

On 8-bit game... about zombies.. what would u think? jsut a simple 'point n' shoot' ? Naah, It's an survival game, a grate survival zombie apo. game. Lots of random situations and some ester egs from l4d :D Simply amazing, Mafi Aproved. :)

This games breaths retro, looks really nice that way but unfortunately it's not worth buying. I really wanted to play this game, but somehow the controls keeps me away from it. The player moves slowly using the WASD keys, and has to shoot by first holding down the left mouse button, pulling back to aim, and letting go. It's a deliberately awkward system that results in regular misses and forces the player to stop and aim carefully. I tried even a Xbox 360 controller but was even more frustrating. Too bad they choose for this, because it ruined everything for me.. :'(

This games breaths retro, looks really nice that way but unfortunately it's not worth buying. I really wanted to play this game, but somehow the controls keeps me away from it. The player moves slowly using the WASD keys, and has to shoot by first holding down the left mouse button, pulling back to aim, and letting go. It's a deliberately awkward system that results in regular misses and forces the player to stop and aim carefully. I tried even a Xbox 360 controller but was even more frustrating. Too bad they choose for this, because it ruined everything for me.. :'(

I myself have never been a fan of zombie games. Other than tell tales walking dead, I have not found myself very interested in most zombie games. I hated left4dead, and thought dead island was incredibly medicore. But this game is AMAZING. despite using an 'atari' graphical style, and not exactually riviting in terms of music or dialouge ect, I found myself more emotionally attached to my own pixelated characters. Than any triple A zombie game out there. As you progress, your resources get lower and lower, and things get tougher. The game gave me an odd sense of doom, but hope at the same time. And that hope is what kept me playing. To make it through. I usually for the most part do not like indie games. But with it's cheap price, and great replay value, I highly highly reccomended this. I would hope for a sequel. But maybe it's better off being a stand alone game. Whoever made this game, I commend you for the great amount of effort put into this simplistic but at the same time, complicated game.  The game is primarly about resource managment, and going across the USA, in hopes of getting to your final destination, 'safe haven' you have to survive zombies, bandits, and get supplies, fix your car, ect, it's based off one of my favorite PC game series, 'The Oregon Trail' I might even argue that this game is a tad bit better than the original Oregon Trail games. I'd highly reccomended it.
I recommend this game it's fun you can upgrade your car and name your own follows it's a good little game to pass the time

Organ Trail was an okay distraction but there's no real meat to the game. Some events are reused constantly (I swear, if I have to avoid another biker gang...) and the basic gameplay is too simplistic to engage me even as a pick up and play game. I finished it but wouldn't play it again nor recommend it for other people.
Meh, didn't live up to the hype.
It's a very basic Oregon Trail look a like. Not as fun as the original game.
it's really good
I want my 5$ back :(

I was at THE LAST MISSION. I was on the end. A freakin zombie popped out of nowhere. All my teamates died. THE GAME ENDED. Literally. Im not joking. This game is fun. But if your friends die try ONCE not twice. I was at safe heaven getting the fuel and I DIED. 11/10 gameplay. 1/10 Gameplay also.
A brilliant 8-bit, humorus but difficult survival game. Only played for 3.6hrs at the time of writing this but im fully hooked. I can recommend this to anyone who likes survival games and zombies
Trump killed America.   Worth a buy.

I liked this game alot, The graphics are poor and alot of the gameplay is just mini-games strung together, but hey I found that the minigames constantly changed up the game and the rouge-like elements to it made me panic whenever I ran out of somthing. I felt by naming all the charactors people I knew I felt slightly more invested in saving them.   Overall the gameplay is samey and repetitive after you see most of the mini-games it has to offer but, there are harder difficutly levels and that keeps it interesting. far better suited for a tablet but i could see myself playing this for hours on my down time.  I liked it but you may not if you wanted 200 hours of gameplay like in fallout you are out of luck, its a good 2 hours of gameplay and after that its used up its bag of tricks, however the bag is pretty cool to look at for a bit.
Loved it. Very simple controls and awesome strategy. Hilarious as well.

Should I try to bring Bob to the end with me...Or does he take up too much food for us...Should I...Kill him?   These are some of the tough decisions you'll have to make in this strangely interesting game. Based on the old classic , 'Oregon Trail', the game throws you in a party with 4 other surivors trying to make it safely to the end. You start with chosen supplies, points will be given to you to allocate to different areas, and then you're off. Random events, strangers, evil deer and an immortal bear will try to hinder your journey throughout the way. The graphics and sound are not worth mentioning because, in all honesty, they're terrible...but it is still a decent game to play for the price in which it is offered at.  This is a great game to play if you have some time to kill. You can choose to act at your own pace, except when the gameplay moves from it's text to real time play...so it is perfect if you're doing something else. For me, I loaded it up while I was waiting for a que to pop in WoW...But anyways...  I'd recommend this game to anyone,(unless graphics are a thing for you) a solid 8/10.
Zombie survivors? Take notes: 1. Snatch old station wagon 2. GO!
Organ Trail is a hilarious take on the original 'Oregon Trail' video games of the early 1990s. Fight against zombies and try to reach safety. Highly recommended.

What can I say...Simple strategy game that is interesting for a moment. The biggest disappointment is that I put time into this for the sake of completion, but the developers could not even get such a simple thing right, thus no matter what I do, I cannot trigger a few of the achievements!  My belief is that if you are going to do something, do it right! They are incapable of doing the simplest of things right.  Sadly, if I knew I could not 100% this game I would NEVER had put any amount of time into this game other than the first quick playthrough. It is actually very upsetting the amount of time they have wasted!
The aiming is incredibly frustrating and makes me want to punch baby penguins.
I have 2 hours in this lmao
Repetitive, dull. and shallow. Only enjoyable as a parody of Oregon Trail, but not a satisfying game experience in its own right. You don't even get an ending.
Very fun indie game, Its oregon trail, with a zombie twist.
zombies r nice addition liek if u agresa withs mee
Yes, please.

Sadly, as a Brit, I got no history with the old Oregon Trail game. Ask my about BBC Model B educational games, I can talk for hours. So the joke of a zombie Oregon Trail don't mean much to me. Thankfully, it's a rock hard mix of old-school text sim (a la Lemonade Stand!) mixed with the Walking Dead & the odd 2D shooter part. You will die. Randomly. And it's fun to die. Randomly.  If the idea of managing fuel consumption, spare parts for your car, and dealing with random text missions from strangers through 2D shooty parts appeals, this is the game for you.

Most certainly a great game, I ended up naming one character after my best friends, and showered the ground in his brains. Truley a great game, an amazing spin off to Oregan Trail, and a suprisingly time consuming game, but who says thats a bad thing!

Rob ford smashed 3 of my tires and Jackie chan was killed by bandits. Oh what a glorious game this is. I acutally played the original Oregan trail when I was a little reaper and this take on point and click with a little action was indeed fun and worth 2$.  9/10.
Why to get this game: 1) The game has differnt modes to play in 2) That thr price is good for the game 3) The easter eggs this game has  4) And that you play in the zombie infected USA
This game rocks... even though i killed my friends

I may have a short play time on this game but here is my story.  I started by meeting Clements. Nice chap saved my life and we were happy. We got to a place which I didnt read cus f*** that. He found my friends Arya,Lara,Anton and Harry. We set off strong with plenty of medkits after shooting Clements in the face cus he got bitten. We go for a way until disaster strikes. Lara breaks their arm and leg during 20 miles. This leaves her incapacitated. Shortly before we reach the next area she dies as I had run out of medkits. Next we reach the next area a bit shaken by the loss but the moment we leave Harry is bitten by a zombie. I still had no medkits so I was forced to kill him leaving me Anton and Arya. It was then that disaster struck. Arya was hit by a stray bullet and is incapacitated. He dies quickly as I had no medkits. Me and Anton go far and are very close to the end with us being very healthy. Then Anton is hit by a stray bullet. He is not incapped and we continue but shortly after he is hit again by ANOTHER stray bullet. This incapps him and he dies when a blizzard strikes. I make it to the safe haven with low ammo but full hp. I fight through the zombies and am finally safe.  10/10 would watch my friends die again.

This game is an absolute piece of junk on PC, and while I had someone swear it was great on a touchscreen, this isn't a tablet and the shooting/moving is so awful that I regret the single dollar I blew on it to find out this fact. SUCKS SORRY

Dad got killed by bandits Mum broke her leg driving on a straight road Best mate became a zombie and I traded him for $500   Enjoyed this a lot more than I expected. Will replay later. Aiming has a learning curve, as well as strategies for trading, when to travel, etc.

This game taught me a valuable lesson that no matter how bad my injuries are, resting is all I need to be at perfect health. Also one of my guys was bitten by a zombie in the beginning of the game. My constant sleeping habits were enough for him to not turn for the rest of the game.  GET YOUR SLEEP FOLKS
Buy this and play it. Worth the pennies it costs. Take a trip down memory lane, but add zombies and humor.
Cute take on an edutainment classic. 7/10.
Brought me back to my childhood playing old school games like this. Very cheap and very addicting. I recommend playing this on easy or normal first.
Fun game , just like the old Oregon trail but with Zed!! Not sure if it has a lot of replay ability but for under 5 bucks I would buy it just to support the creativity of the Devs. Fun stuff.
One of my favorite indie games.

IT'S FINALLY ON STEAM! After waiting since December, it finally gets here. This game is a great twist of the original 'Oregon Trail'. WIth a group of you and your friends, you are faced with the task of getting across America in high hopes of a safe haven. It may not have the coolest graphics, but it makes up for it with fantastic gameplay.
A good $5 game to share with your friends. Multi-player might have been nice, but still fun nontheless.
Best. Game. Ever. That is generally a remake of an old classic. I recommend all the money's to this game.
I loved the Organ Trail it made me feel like I was younger in school but with a twist that I really loved in the game... This game makes me have a huge smile on my face, dead or alive.
It would be interesting if the shooting controls weren't abysmal.

So one day Me, ♥♥♥♥ Tracey, Mr. Gibbles, Sheckles Goldstein, and 420McBlazeIt all set out to survive the zombie apocalypse. All of us were in good health when I discovered an achievement for murdering your party when they are healthy. The next day I showed up at my destination alone and an achievement richer.
Got good replay value, especially if you have many friends.

A bandit snuck up on me and grabbed a member of my party. I tried to shoot the bandit, but missed. The bandit shot the kidnapped party member in the back of the head and ran off.   Didn't try to steal anything. Didn't offer a ransom or any kind of hostage negotiation. Just killed my guy and ran off. For absolutely no reason.     10/10
This is an amazing game! I bought this thinking it would just be a 30 minute play-and-throwaway, but it surpassed my expectations tenfold. If I had to give it a rating, it would be a 10/10
Really fun, mechanic is better than a lot of some other high-graphic required game. ps. sorry for my poor english
Nice game, but my friends always throw the good stuff out of the car.

This brought back old, loathing feelings of playing the Oregon Trail in school. But this one is better, because it comes with zombies!   Much like the game this one takes its roots from, it is actually really hard to make it across the map with your whole party alive and well. I thought I was doing well; I was 2/3 the way across the map, and then bam-- one dead from thirst, another knocked out from fighting through the horde of angry bikers, and to top it off we were out of money!  My favorite part was taking up random jobs for supplies or money. Even though the graphics aren't state of the art, I still felt engrossed in the missions. I also felt very much in danger. The zombies tend to pile up fast!  If for no other reason, get this game for the satisfaction of taking out one of your own when they are infected with the zombie virus!
This game is really fun. It does take a while to play through once, but it is till quite entertaining. If you are looking for a simple, fun game to play, this game is for you.
Surprisingly good! Love it!
The shooting system is terrible

my first game: survivors jax,ally,nick,rayn and gavin they had found themselves stuck unable to repair there car when jax out of madness kills the the whole group and was ♥♥♥♥♥♥ at gavin for breaking all the stuff and lossing money so he shot him in the gut then he was about to let a zombie eat him but he got scrap to repair the car but because he was so depresed he hit a speed bumb and crashed and then died the end
A good game based upon 'The Oregon Trail, but with added zombies.

I enjoyed it for the price ($4.99), spent about 3 hours on my first playthrough. I played on normal, and it seemed like the secret was just waiting for trading until low zombie activity, then scavanging (easily getting tons of food, scrap, and money) and trading said supplies for fuel and other car parts. I ended with 40+ fuel, over 1500 food, 20 medkits, and 6 of every car part. The gameplay started getting repetitive, so maybe the expansion will help, but it would have to be on sale for me to want to get it.

It's fine for the first hour, then gets really, really boring. There's very little variety, and it takes ages to finish a run.  Maybe you can coast through it on nostalgia alone, but you'd have to REALLY love the original to justify even the 5 dollar price tag.

This is an amusingly fun game. I used to play Oragon trail ALL the time growing up and I never could find a game to do it justice until now. Except now it has Zombies. It's like the 10 year old kid gets a retro game from her childhood and the 30 year old gets zombies.  You have done my childhood justice.
It is a fun game buuuuuttttt, i love survive games and this one just takes far to long for me sorry.
This game rules. I'm sad I put off getting it for so long. Just like Oregon Trail, only add apocolyptic :) Scavanging and defending kinda make for cool little shooter mini games

without the dlc, its not as big, but primarily the game is very fun! Dosent take that long on easy mode, but normal mode game me dysterny on the first day lol. U guys who like zombie games and retro games will love this. Think about it like retro dayz with mario graphics!
Gotta love the fact that someone farting is so crucial it stops your game to tell you!  10/10

Amazingly fun, as addictive as the original 'Oregon Trail'.  The graphics are basic but they are all that is needed. I was engrosed in 8bit story-telling and i love the messages that come up. 'Tanner went out for a ♥♥♥♥ and never returned' or 'Abram was dicking around with the battery and ruined it'. Great time, enjoyed the game thoroughly.  My only complaint was that money was EXTREMELY hard to come by when playing on normal version. This ultimately meant that I died because we ran out of fuel, even though I knew it was coming there wasnt much I could do to stop it. I scavanged 10 times in a row, traded every chance i got, and couldn't find fuel anywhere. I had a multitude of food, scrap, and ammo, but was always dying for fuel and money. I would love to try the combat training but at $80 I don't think I ever had that much money to my name the whole game, let alone have $80 to spare!  Overall fun game, I put my friends' names in the spots and took pictures of the messages as I played and sent the messages to them over text. They got a kick out of it and consequently have all purchased the game. Good game, minor balance tweaks and it would be PERFECT!
This is a bad game i repeat do not buy

Captures the charm of the original Oregon Trail, in a colorful reimagining of a zombie apocalypse. If you spent hours playing Oregon Trail as a kid and fell in love with the Walking Dead as an adult (which I did) you will love it! 10/10. Would play again.
great game, have on mobile as well, beat it there several times.  10/10 Would cry to an invincible Chuck Norris taking on a nuke again

Organ trail is like Oregon Trail except all your friends are probably gonna get shot by bandits because you have horrible aim. Add zombies to anything and I will come so it's 7/10 cause replayability is kinda low for me. Gets repetitive.

This was so fun to play. When you are just looking for a chill game with some laughs and a bit of skill requirement, this is the game to play.   I don't know how sitting on $20 makes it useless, but that is the wacky logic of Organ Trail!
This game remind me of my life.  10/10 Historically Accurate
A really well made game. Enjoying every minute of it ! You should try it out if you like retro-survival stuff

I absolutely love this game! It is a great game, and it is so well though out! I love that you are in a station wagon instead of a covered wagon! Genuis! Cannot say enough good things about this game!
This is not the game I thought it was... o.o

'Oregeon Trail? Isn't that the game where everyone gets dysentary? The game which is supposed to be really annoying, hard, cheap, and not at all fun to play?'. Let's just say I have not heard good things about the Apple II video game this Greenlit, Kickstarted gem that has landed its way into my Steam library is based after. All it took was one quick Let's Play from one of the only people I will ever pay attention to on YouTube in order for this to be immediatly bought. What I discovered was a faciniating point A to point B zombie survival game that I didn't immedatly hate. Calling it text-based is incorrect, but it's pretty close description to those who have not seen or heard of this game yet. It's freakishly addicting, the random generated events keep it fresh and fun, and even when the game screws you over you'll still be enjoying the moment!
It's a good spin off on the Zombie 'pop culture'

A very fun, pixelated, oregon trail spoof game. Its oregon trail with zombies, so I'm sure you know how the game plays. I found it to be very fun, but not all that hard when you get the hang of it. I would definitely recommend it for both serious gamers and casual gamers.
has that retro feel, and a witty sense of humor which keeps the game going when you have to put down all you friends because they were infrected, or you just wanted to.
I absolutely love this game.  It's Atari like graphics, really bring back memories, and the campaign is actually very fun. I'll admit it, this game surprise me on how good it was.

The first pc game I ever played Oregeon Trail, and this brought back both happy and horrible memories of playing it. No matter the preperation you may have, events may bungle you, and then camps with supplies you don't need to be followed can always end a journey to disaster.  So what we have is a game that is part wisdom and big part luck. The upside is that you can name people whatever you wish, and it hit me deep when I had to put Morgan Freeman down after he was bit.
A twisted take on the Oregon Trail - get across a zombie-infested wasteland to a safe haven on the west coast. Fun and funny!
Pew Pew watching zombies shoo
The only game in which you can sell your best friends for gas money.
A simple diversion for an afternoon for those who have fond primary school memories of the edutainment title 'Oregon Trail'.

Lovely, lovely game.  The first run through is an absolute practice to understand how often things break and how to use the mouse properly.  The second run through is an attempt to apply lessons from the first run, with an emphasis on aggression.  Eventually you'll settle down and play the game as you're supposed to, which is however you'd like to.
Good game to waste some time on!
A great retro ride with plenty of L4D2 in-jokes. Try it as a change-of-pace.

This game is a very fun survival game where every choice you make changes everything. I wanted to enjoy it more than I did. I was in the last pitstop before the final destonation in the game and then the gaem just broke on me. I have encountered numorous bugs that seem so common I'm surprised they haven't been fixed.  I wanted to enjoy this game way more but the bugs just killed me  6/10
it was prety good at first but mine stopped working :( !
A creative retake on a classic game. If you were a fan of Oregon Trail when you were younger and you like the zombie genre, you'll love this game.
Remember that old game you played on the computers in elementary school? Well this is pretty much the same thing, except with zombies and a hell of a lot more morbid.
Simple, yet addicting. Perhaps the best zombie game I've played.

If you were in elementary school in the late 80s/early 90s and played Oregon Trail, this game is for you! Has all the same frustrations the original game had, plus a warped sense of zombie humor.  Bit glitchy when going to hunt/shoot with the gun, but after a few rounds of shooting, you get the hang of it.  If you're looking for a nostalgia trip of the mature, zombie variety, Organ Trail is for you!
This is exactly what I wanted out of this title. The Men Who Wear Many Hats delivered a classic style entertaining game that has me very much satified. Oh and ZOMBIES/Dysentery is the enemy!
This game is loaded with nostalgia for fans of its classic namesake.
It can be a bit buggy at times, but otherwise it's amazing.

'Oregeon Trail? Isn't that the game where everyone gets dysentary? The game which is supposed to be really annoying, hard, cheap, and not at all fun to play?'. Let's just say I have not heard good things about the Apple II video game this Greenlit, Kickstarted gem that has landed its way into my Steam library is based after. All it took was one quick Let's Play from one of the only people I will ever pay attention to on YouTube in order for this to be immediatly bought. What I discovered was a faciniating point A to point B zombie survival game that I didn't immedatly hate. Calling it text-based is incorrect, but it's pretty close description to those who have not seen or heard of this game yet. It's freakishly addicting, the random generated events keep it fresh and fun, and even when the game screws you over you'll still be enjoying the moment!
You find Kittens, choose to keep them, and then proceed to have 10 oz of food added. 10/10
Great game, worth every penny.
Fun game , just like the old Oregon trail but with Zed!! Not sure if it has a lot of replay ability but for under 5 bucks I would buy it just to support the creativity of the Devs. Fun stuff.

Purchased at $2  I enjoyed it once through but I don't see myself replaying it a dozen times, like the achievements expect you to. It certainly brought me back to the days of Oregon Trail in kindergarten.
Just like the classic game you played on an Apple IIc, but with more shambling hoards.
Much better than I was expecting! Lots of fun nostalgia with recorded Apple II keyboard sounds and stuff. It takes itself just seriously enough while still having a great sense of humor.
Slow and somewhat boring. Lots of luck involved. Only for the patient adventurer.
Overall pretty good game needs work gameplay is not the greatest. and needs some more character development. but it was a pretty fun game
Dysentery.
Survived the perils of the shambling horde with Jon Romero 10/10

Name your party members after your friends and embrace the mayhem. Game play is basically a clone of Oregon Trail's game play. The journey was fun, and brought a nice sense of nostalgia along with a few laughs. I expect to replay it a couple more times just for fun. I recommend this game to anyone that enjoys zombie fiction, retro gaming, or laughing at your friends for getting cholera. ~ 10/10
This game is a blast! It could easily cost more!

A loving homage to the impossible-as-hell classic we knew from grade school. New setting, new enemies, same difficulty. Old mechanics tweaked surprisingly little to provide a fun little zombie trek across America. Takes about an hour or two to make it to Oregon. Get moving!

Much simple. Very entertain. Wow. Everything I loved about the pick up and play fetures of Oregon Trail sprinkled with zombies and waaaay better events and minigames. It's something I can play at any time, even during lunch breaks. I can see myself playing this game over and over for the forseeable future.
Remember that old game you played on the computers in elementary school? Well this is pretty much the same thing, except with zombies and a hell of a lot more morbid.
Unexplainably addictive. Theres ons of replayability in the endless mode. The game itself is really basic but its fun! Definitely worth $4.99 and a steal at anything less.

Despite very dated graphics there is something charming about this game. The story, accidents on the way, pretty much all the things you could possibly encounter during your postapocalyptic east to west trip. There is a micromanaging part which I especially like about this game. It's about being smart when it comes to planning, to avoid being stranded or pushed against the wall. You can also name your companions after your friends or family and go for hardest level to enhance the mood. Will you sacrifice your beloved one if he's turning into a zombie? Will you swap your buddy for 10 gallons of gas and cart of food?  And there's this special kind of '8-bit atmosphere' when it's middle of the night and you sit in glow of your monitor ekhm.. TV with the sound of crickets and digital bleeps :)
Good Game to see if you can make it. Losing somone in the party is always interesting and hunting a challenge. It's a new spin on an older game and not as easy as one would think. Nice game
Worth the buy!!

This game taught me a valuable lesson that no matter how bad my injuries are, resting is all I need to be at perfect health. Also one of my guys was bitten by a zombie in the beginning of the game. My constant sleeping habits were enough for him to not turn for the rest of the game.  GET YOUR SLEEP FOLKS

Organ Trail is like the Oregon Trail. Not much to be said, really. Most people with gaming experience would know what this is like.  Pros:  Bringing back an old game for a newer market, with a unique twist and added features  Controls AREN'T bad, considering that this was also developed for tablets in mind as well as the PC version.  Forces you to make choices that determine whether or not you kill your allies.  It's like The Walking Dead, but 8-bit and less story driven.  Cons:  I understand the need to have a unique shooting style, but seriously? Clicking on the enemy and dragging to your character is a pain when scavenging.  I have learnt things from combat trainers about 3 times. Not because their skill are useless, because they apparantly have nothing they can teach me.  If you want to start with less than 5 people, you have to waste ammo (NOT A REAL CON).  Overall, this is a great revival of a great classic. If it's on sale, grab this game. Hell, just grab the game anyway.  ~You've got red on you.

Back when the world made sense, we used to go to this place called the Library, where I spent many days of my young life playing Oregon Trail on the Commodore 64 after school. This was an awesome idea for a game and I purchased it without hesitation.  Oozing with nostalgia. 10/10
killed all my best friends with dynamite 10/10
Accidentally shot hostage Jesus in the face. 8/8 worth spending eternity in hell.
Amazing game. Would recommend to anyone, since it can run on anything. 10/10

I keep coming back to do another run. The managing part is quite fun and it's always interesting to see how your teammates always find a way to doom themselves.  Honestly a good game, I don't even care that the visuals are potato level.
This is an AMAZING game. only one problem... HASENT BEEN UPDATED SINCE 2013!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! But still, GET THIS GAME
Great throwback to old computer games, and a fun twist to Oregon Trail.
Dysentery, bandits and zombies oh my!

The game is harsh. Very harsh. It is one of those games where you will play it for a good few hours only to realise you were wasting your time. It is similar to Crazy Taxi, no not because of the gameplay but because it is a game you will only play for a couple hours at a time but you will be determined to come back to it a lot and complete it on all of the difficulties. The game has good mechanics but the shooting just seems a bit overcomplicated which may have been done to prevent it from being too easy, but now the shooting could be considered a bit too frustrating... Overall I would reccomend the game because it is cheap, especially on sale, and it is worth the money, but don't expect an easy relaxing game, this is a very challenging and stressful game!  + Immersive + Addictive + Passes the time quickly - May get frustrating due to RNG - Some annoying mechanics

Fun game, lots of replayability. Good sound design, reminescent of the old computers.  EDIT: Still an excellent game, more than worth its selling price alone, but now with new DLC which adds even more to the game! Definitely nice to see the devs still caring about this game somewhat.
My group got annoying so I put them all down in the first ten minutes
Although it's a bit simple, it's worth 5 bucks in my book for Taylor Swift, Kim Jong Un, Kayne West, Bill Nye, and Mia Khalifa in a post-apocolyptic organ trail.
Our group survived off the money we made from selling Tony Abbott as a slave

I only just played this, but I had to recommend it. It is a zombie movie, in all respects. It's a tough fight to survive, and very emotional. Emotions don't come from having pretty graphics.  It comes from choosing between your best friend's life, and those of five innocent strangers. It comes from watching your sister be executed by a maniac when you miss the shot that would save her. It comes from watching your boyfriend get infected, and wondering if you can keep him healthy and alive during the trip.  And all that was just my first play through...

This game doesn't just claim to be Oregon Trail. It literally channels the ghost of that game so perfectly, you might forget that you aren't actually playing it.  It's not just a cheesy ripoff either. It is faithful to the source material but it still maintains it's own unique aspects and introduces new 'minigames'. You still have to manage resources and scarcity. There is plenty of scavenging and trading. You're still at the helm of a wagon, but instead of fording rivers you have to ford throngs of zombies. Instead of snake bites there are zombie bites. You still can't carry back all the food.  Oh, and there's lots of dysentery.

Many gamers my age remember playing Oregon Trail in elementary school where most of us were massacred by natives or crushed by wagon wheels and 3rd world diseases. I pitty those who hadn't because such experiences have made such a game as Organ Trail even more humurous to play.  Fashioned in the manner of ancient Atari games they don't interfere with the sheer absurdity players are sure to experience in this hilarious post-apocalyptic road trip across the United States in a station wagon. An obvious play on the caravans of Oregon Trail. Here, players can create several members of their party to tag along with during their journey through swarms of zombies, camps of survivors and trips through the wilderness for supplies.  Don't hesitate to pick up this game if you're interested after my explanation because you will find near endless entertainment.

The trailer alone sold me (along with the screenshots)  To be honest, this game is great!  I have already spent way longer on it than I'd like to admit.  It's funny, well-written, and easy to play. Also, when you finally reach your destination, there is a wonderfully inherent sense of satisfaction. I'd say the satisfaction is ALMOST as sweet as killing your stupid, stupid tag-alongs when they lose 7 gallons of gas (the only gas you have).  It's cheap, and I'll bet you will have a good time with it, especially if you sank a lot of time playing Oregon Trail as a kid.
good game overall... I keep passing my tombstones and they always say, 'get a life'...... What does it mean?

Zombies are kinda overdone, but this game at least puts a unique twist on it by parodying Oregon Trail. Can be beaten in one sitting, about three hours, but it's a fun three hours. Lot of people ♥♥♥♥♥ about the shooting mechanics, but it kind of reminds me of playing missile command on atari. Not a bad game.
Fun as ♥♥♥♥, but after you play with the same pair for awhile you kinda get bored of it.
Amazing game if your ever stressed sit down and just go on a zombie ride
Good Game, easy to master but hard to get through.
I got to St Louis and had to kill everyone since they were all incapacitated and used up my recourses.
The only negative thing I can say about this game is certain achievements don't work. it's really fun.
Fun twist on the Oregon Trail formula. About as replayable as the inspiration. Throw friends and family in as characters for extra fun.
One of my favourites. I keep coming back to this game.
Games hard af, but its a good challenge and very addicting  7/10 would reccomend (I suggest playing with friends)
Suddenly, dysentery doesn't seem quite that bad
This hidden gem of a game combines everyone's favorite classic game, Oregon Trail, with everyone's new favorite genre, zombies!
All of my friends acted like bumbling idiots and broke things, and yet still managed to stay alive.  10/10 3Accurate5Me
